content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is showing Ross, Rachel, Joey, and Phoebe his engagement ring again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: God that is the most beautiful engagement ring ever!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah? Well, you should know. You’ve bought like a billion of ‘em.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you didn’t get one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, well tonight’s the big night.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay listen, how are you gonna ask her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is going to be perfect. I am taking her to her favorite restaurant. I’m going to get her a bottle of the champagne that she really loves; therefore knows how expensive it is. Then when the glasses are full, instead of proposing a toast I’m just gonna propose.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That sounds perfect!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re gonna mess it up let me do it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not gonna mess it up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If she says no, can I have the ring?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s not gonna say no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!
(Monica’s entrance makes Phoebe try to hide the ring by putting it in her mouth.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi Monica.
(Monica goes into her room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Give me it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s gone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe!
(She takes it out of her mouth and hands it to him as Monica returns from her room and this time forcing Chandler to put the ring in his mouth.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi Monica.
(She goes into the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’re practically kissing. (Makes a kissy face and winks at him.)

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey are there as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are any of you guys free tonight? My boss is hosting this charity event for underprivileged kids and the more people I bring, the better I look. So, Monica? Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, Monica and Chandler can’t go. We’re going to dinner remember?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s the big deal?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just get mad when Rachel doesn’t remember where we’re going.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where are you going?
(Chandler stares at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How about you guys? (Points to Phoebe and Joey.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Open bar?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think so.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can do that for the kids.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, y’know what? I’ll come too. I’m making money now; it’s about time I give something back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you could also give back the money you owe me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Have a benefit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Ross, listen can you come to a charity event tonight?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no, I have plans with Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so you’re already doing your part for the kids.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, it’s just one of my last nights together before she leaves for camp—to be a counselor!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross let me ask you a question. All jokes aside, where is this relationship going?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, all jokes aside? I didn’t agree to that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you really see this as a long-term thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, you are 12 years older than her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, does-does everyone feel this way?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! Yeah, sort of. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-uh—Wow! Uh, I thought you guys were just like making jokes, I had no idea. What you know what? You guys are wrong. Uh yes, there is a chronological age difference but I never notice it. You know why? Because she is very mature. Besides, it doesn’t really matter to me what you guys think. I mean, I’m the one dating Elizabeth, not you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not what she said last night. (Ross glares at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See? Now, he could date her.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is practicing proposing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Will you marry me? Will you marry me? (Makes like a gun with his fingers.) Hey, you marry me! (He gives up as Joey, Rachel, Phoebe, and Ross slink in all excited.) What’s going on little elves?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s the big night! We wanted to wish you good luck!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah you have the ring?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, right here in my pocket. (Pats his pocket. Phoebe smiles, goes over to hug him, and removes the ring from his pocket.) Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Oop! (Hands him back the ring.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, now will you guys get out of here? I want this is to be a surprise and she’s gonna know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah-yeah you guys. Get out of here!
(Monica enters from the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are beautiful.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, thank you! (The gang exhibits signs of quiet apprehension and wears knowing glances.) (Monica giggles.) What’s going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re just really…very excited about this charity event that we have to go to.

content.description: The Charity Event, they’re holding a silent auction, Rachel is looking at one of the items and Phoebe walks up and hands her a glass of wine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Thank you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So now what’s going on here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh well, uh this is a silent auction. They lay out all the stuff here and then you write down your offer and then the highest bid gets it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I know what a silent is I meant, what’s going on with your hair?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, wh-why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! It’s nice!
(Rachel’s boss, Mr. Thompson walks up.)

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Nice to see you Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi!

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: So glad you brought someone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Someone? I brought people. Mr. Thompson, this is Phoebe. Phoebe, this is Mr. Thompson. (She introduces them.) He’s the head of my department.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hi. (They shake hands.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I also brought my friend Joey…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh!! Shrimp toast! (Walks right past the little group on his way for the shrimp toast.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know I-I don’t know where he is.

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Well, I hope you’re gonna bid on some things Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know what? Actually, I was about to bid on this lovely trip to Paris.

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Ohh, nice choice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Good luck.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (Mr. Thompson walks away and after he’s left.) Okay, (writing her bid down) twenty dollars.

content.description: Elizabeth’s Dorm Room, Ross is walking up to her door and knocks on it. Suddenly the door opens and Elizabeth drags him into the room.

content.text: {Transcriber’s Note: Elizabeth has two friends in the room with her who are named in the credits, but not in this scene. So I’m just gonna guess since it doesn’t matter one way or the other. (The last part is to discourage e-mails, who cares if I got it right or not?)}

content.speaker: Zoe
content.text: Shut the door! Shut the door!! (Runs over and closes the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s-what’s going on?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: The guys across the hall are throwing water balloons at us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you have to call the police! That’s what I did to the kids in my building!

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: No, it’s a water balloon fight! We started it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! (Does a laugh/groan.) Listen umm, I, I just stopped by to see if you wanted to see this play tonight. Umm, it’s supposed to be excellent. The director is the same…

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Who drank all the Kamikazes?
content.parenthetical: ignoring him and picking up a pitcher

content.speaker: Sarah
content.text: Nobody! We put them in here! (Indicates the aforementioned balloons causing both of them to scream in delight and start drinking from the balloons.)
content.parenthetical: approaching with two filled balloons in her hands

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: You want some?! (Starts to squirt the Kamikaze at him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Okay! Okay! (Stops her.) Okay, look, can I, can I just-just talk to you for a second?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Yeah, sure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, so this play umm, what do you think? It’s-it’s gotten great reviews! Y’know the uh…
(Suddenly the door opens and two guys come rushing in wielding water balloons.)

content.speaker: First Dorm Guy
content.text: Attack!
(They start lobbing the balloons in. Ross desperately tries to get out of the line of fire but is struck in the back. The girls all retreat to relative safety behind the couch.)

content.speaker: Second Dorm Guy
content.text: Put your balloons down!

content.speaker: The Girls
content.text: You put your balloons down!!

content.speaker: First Dorm Guy
content.text: You put your balloons down!!
(Both opposing camps start screaming at each other to drop their weapons and surrender. Finally, Ross steps in as a mediator.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Everybody put their balloons down !!! (There is a temporary cease fire.) Now this is a nice suit!! (Shows everyone where he was hit.)

content.description: The Charity Event, Mr. Thompson is announcing the winners of the silent auction.

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Our next item is the romantic trip to Paris. (Pause.) It goes to Emil Alexander high a high bid of 2,300.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! So close!
(Phoebe returns a with a tray full of different kinds of drinks.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys! Look!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I got me some drinks!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Open bar!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well now it’s an empty bar.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You just can’t stand anyone else enjoying themselves can’t you?

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: And finally, our biggest item of the night, the 22-foot gentleman’s day sailer sailboat. The winning bid was a whooping $20,000! (Joey suddenly gets excited.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I won! That was my guess!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! What?! What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I guessed 20,000!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! It is an auction! You don’t guess, you buy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! I don’t have 20,000!

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Congratulations on your new boat, Joey Tribbiani!!
(Everyone applauds and he stands up slowly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! Sit down! (Pulls him down.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Forget her! You enjoy this!! (Pulls him back up and starts applauding again. Joey waves and does a salute.]

content.description: A Restaurant, Monica and Chandler are sitting at a table. Monica is checking her makeup as Chandler suddenly has a horrifying thought and starts patting down his pockets until he finds what he’s looking for and sighs in relief.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: One nation, under God. Indivisible with liberty and justice for all. (Laughs.) I remembered it. (It’s a butchered version of the Pledge of Allegiance of the United States for our foreign friends.) The champagne is here. (The waiter is delivering it and pouring two glasses.)
content.parenthetical: trying to cover up why his hand is over his heart

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Yes! I’m good! Are you good? Are you good? Is everything—are you—are you perrr-perfect?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. I’m okay. I’m actually—I’m a little cold, can I have your jacket?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah. (Starts to take it off and then realizes) Uh, no you can’t have my jacket! Because then I would be cold! If you thought that you were going to be cold, you should’ve brought your own jacket. But uh, other than that, are you okay? Are you okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure you’re okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! I’m fine. In fact I’ve been fine for a long time now and I think, the reason is you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh that’s sweet!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay umm, before I meant you I had really little life and I couldn’t imagine growing old with…

(As he’s talking Monica notices someone familiar has just entered the restaurant. Let’s see; I seem to remember him driving a Ferrari in Hawaii solving crimes as a private investigator and as a certain eye doctor in more recent times.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, but just let me say it.
content.parenthetical: not knowing the true meaning of her exclamation

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, Richard. (Yep, Richard’s back.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?! I’m Chandler! (She nods towards the doorway, Chandler turns and looks) Oh, that’s Richard!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, maybe he won’t see us. Richard!
(Monica smiles then acts shocked. Chandler can’t believe she just did that.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Monica! Chandler!
content.parenthetical: approaching them with a woman in tow

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey, hey! (Gets up and hugs him.) I don’t know why I did that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, it’s good to see you!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You too, you let uh, your hair grow long.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah—Oh that’s right. You, you always wanted me too. Hey, I see you got your mustache back.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, my nose got lonely.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And uh, you don’t have a mustache which is good. (She just smiles.) I’m Chandler; I make jokes when I’m uncomfortable.

content.speaker: Richard’s Date
content.text: Hi, I’m Lisa.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. (Introduces them.) Lisa, (nodding at each) Monica, Chandler. We used to date.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Richard! No one supposed to know about us! (Richard just smiles at him.) See I, did it again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, wh-why don’t we sit down?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’ll sit down. (He slides back into his chair.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s good to see you

content.speaker: Matire’d
content.text: You’re table’s ready sir.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh. Good to see you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. (Thinking he’s gone.)

content.speaker: Matire’d
content.text: Or if you prefer, this table is available.
content.parenthetical: motioning to the empty table next to Monica and Chandler’s

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: That might be fun. (Richard and Lisa sit down.)

content.description: The Charity Event, Rachel, Phoebe, and Joey are sitting at their table.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What were you thinking?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t know it was an auction!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I figured, take a guess, help a charity, free boat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why would a charity give away a free boat?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! Charity?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, just buy the damn boat! (She’s still working her way through her tray of booze.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, don’t you think you’ve had enough to drink?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just helping the kids!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How is you drinking helping the kids?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because the more I drink, the less there is for the kids to drink.

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Mr. Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hi!

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: Your generous contribution brings us a big step closer to building the youth center.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just out of curiosity, how-how much is that boat worth?

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: I think it was valued at 19,000

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I was pretty close. (She just glares at him.) Uhh, so bad news. Umm, I can’t buy the boat, I don’t have any money.
(Mr. Thompson looks shocked and at Rachel, she suddenly starts laughing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! Joey, good one! (Mr. Thompson starts to laugh.)

content.speaker: Mr. Thompson
content.text: That’s good. Very good! (Walks away.)
(After he’s left, Rachel stops laughing and glares at Joey again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So uh listen, I think I’m gonna take off now. (Starts to get up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! You…can’t…leave Joey! You agreed to buy that boat, all right?! That is a contract! And plus if you leave, my boss is gonna kill me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, what am I gonna do Rach?! I don’t have that kind of money!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. Okay. (Whispering and thinking.) Okay. Okay. All right. All right, this is what we’re gonna do, we are gonna go to the next highest bidder, and we are just gonna let them buy it, and then you’re just gonna pay the difference.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I don’t know why the kids need a youth center anyway! Y’know? They should just watch TV after school like I did and I turned out fine!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not great.

content.description: The Restaurant, Monica and Chandler’s and Richard and Lisa’s tables have been pushed together and they’re all eating and talking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And so, we’re hiding in the bathroom.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: And-and then I sneak out and before Monica can her parents come in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So I hide in the shower and the next thing you know they’re going at it right on the bathroom floor.

content.speaker: Lisa
content.text: Oh my God!
{Transcriber’s Note: For further reading on the above story, please check out The One Where Joey Moves Out.}

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got a good one, I got a good one! I once walked in on both my parents making love to the same guy.
(An awkward silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: It’s so great seeing you guys again. I’d like to make a toast. (Everyone raises their glasses) Uh, as a poet once said, “In the sweetness of friendship, let there be laughter and sharing of pleasures for in the due of little things the heart finds it’s morning and is refreshed.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!
(They all drink.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica and Chandler are returning to find Ross is there waiting for them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, you guys!! (He’s excited about what he thought happened.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Before you say anything, have we got a story for you! Guess who we bumped into at dinner!
content.parenthetical: stopping him from going any further

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Richard!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (Excited) A-ohh! (Realizes) Ohh. Oh that’s right that’s right. That’s Richard’s favorite place too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh you knew that. Good!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought you were going out with Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I was but uh, she was a little busy with a water balloon fight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh Ross, sometimes grown-ups have commitments they just can’t get out of!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, maybe she is too young for me. Y’know, when I was over there and she was running around with her friends, I felt like I was a baby-sitter. I finally started to see what you guys were talking about. I don’t know what to do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just weigh out the good stuff about the relationship against the bad stuff. I mean that’s what I did when I first (looks at Chandler and pauses) weighing stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay umm, bad stuff. Well, I’m-I’m 12 years older than she is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If the school finds out you’re fired.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s leaving for three months.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: For cam p !

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, good stuff. Umm, well she’s-she’s sweet and pretty and…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look Ross, the only question you need to ask is, “Do you see a future?” I mean like do you see yourself marrying her? (Ross pauses in consideration.) Oh my God! You did it already! You married her, didn’t you?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! I…didn’t do that. It’s just… Okay, honestly no. I don’t, I don’t see a big future with her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay well I think…that’s your answer.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve got to talk to her. Ugh, I hate this part.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you have to forget about Elizabeth. I mean if you’re not careful you may not get married at all this year!

content.description: The Charity Event, Rachel and Phoebe are sitting at the table as Joey approaches.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach! Rachel! Okay, the next highest bidder is at table one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh and uh the guy who got the Paris trip is at table four.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why do you care about the guy who won the Paris trip?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s a trip for two! (She gets up and takes off her blouse-type thingy she’s wearing over her dress.) Excuse me. (She walks over to table four.) Excuse me, is the person who won the Paris trip at this table?

content.speaker: Emil Alexander
content.text: That was me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, en chante. (She holds out her hand for him to kiss it, but he only shakes it.)
{Transcriber’s Note: Please correct my French here.}
[Cut to Joey and Rachel approaching table one.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, excuse me is there a Mr. Bowmont at this table?

content.speaker: Mr. Bowmont
content.text: That’s me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh, yes. (Pushes Rachel in front of himself so that she could do the talking.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well, hello. This is your lucky day Mr. Bowmont, the uh gentleman day sailer as just become available again and I believe that you made a bid of $18,000.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You-you have to pay that! It’s not just a guess.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay. (Shushes him.)

content.speaker: Mr. Bowmont
content.text: I was actually relieved uh I didn’t win the boat. My wife would’ve killed me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you kidding me?! She’s gonna this boat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y-Yeah! What-what is your wife’s name?

content.speaker: Mr. Bowmont
content.text: It’s Pam.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pam! Oh God okay, just imagine this, “The Pam.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aw-awww!

content.speaker: Mr. Bowmont
content.text: I don’t think she’d like that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, uh-uh imagine this, “The Mr. Bowmont.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oooooh…

content.speaker: Mr. Bowmont
content.text: I don’t think so dear.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay look, let me paint you a little picture. (She sits down next to him.) All right, you are settin’ sail up the Hudson! You’ve got the wind in your h—(sees that he’s bald)—arms! You-you get all that peace and quiet that you’ve always wanted! You get back to nature! You can go fishin’! You can—ooh, you can get one of those little hats and have people call you captain, and then when you’re old, Cappy.

content.speaker: Mr. Bowmont
content.text: What the hell, it’s for a good cause! All right!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way! It’s mine!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All that stuff you just said? I want that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But Joey you don’t have $20,000!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who cares?! I-I’ll make payments, whatever it takes, I want the Mr. Bowmont!!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is taking out the garbage as Phoebe and Joey enter. Phoebe gasps.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God, you’re back!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, let me see it! Let me see your hand! (Chandler is frantically trying to wave them off.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why do you want to see my hand?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I wanna see what’s in your hand. I wanna see the trash.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Chandler puts his face in his hands as Joey and Phoebe start to examine the trash.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eww! Oh, it’s all dirty. You should throw this out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Exits to carry out Phoebe’s wishes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What did you guys just do?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Richard was there so I couldn’t do it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! Noooo… (Phoebe gasps.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna do it tomorrow y’know, and-and surprise her, but now you’ve ruined it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We didn’t ruin it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who walks into a room and asks to see a person’s hands?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, a palm reader, a manicurist, a hand doctor…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Glove salesman!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good one! Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is terrible. What am I going to do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, she only suspects something okay? She doesn’t know for sure, so just throw her off the track.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right, I can throw her off. I can make her think marriage is the last thing on my mind.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Yeah! Convince her that-that you’re scared of commitment! Convince her that you’re a little coward!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can do that, I’ve had 30 years of practice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, being you is finally gonna pay off! (They give each other fives.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I had to go all the way to the basement because some idiot keeps stuffing the trash chute with pizza boxes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That guy’s still doing that?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! (Sees Monica, gasps, and runs over to her.) Oh my God you’re here, let me see your hand!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, you’re too late!!! She already took out the trash!!!

content.description: Outside of Elizabeth’s dormitory, Ross is exiting after breaking up with her and we can hear his thoughts.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! I have never had such a healthy break-up! She was such a grown-up about it! She didn’t seem too immature for me! Did I just make a huge mistake?

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: Ross! Wait!
content.parenthetical: sticking her head out her window

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Elizabeth, thank God! I was just thinking about…

content.speaker: Elizabeth
content.text: You suck!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!
(She throws a water balloon at him and hits him on the head and hits him again at the waist with another one.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, break-up’s still on!

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is looking out the window and Joey is sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay, here she comes! (Sits on the couch next to him.) How do I look? Do I look like a guy who doesn’t want to get married?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! And also, a little like a French guy. (They both squint at each other.) I never noticed that before.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you up too?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, just hanging out, talkin’ about uh, websites. (Joey laughs.) Yeah, we saw this really interesting website about marriage and how totally unnecessary it is and how its just a way for the government to keep tabs on you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, Big Brother.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well that’s a little crazy. Although I am y’know glad to hear that you’re branching out on what you look at on the Internet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well… Y’know, it just got me thinking though, why would anybody ever want to get married huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?! To celebrate your relationship! To solidify your commitment! To declare your love for one another to the world!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay well that’s good to know.
(We hear the backup horn of a truck and see through the window that the Mr. Bowmont has arrived.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Mr. Bowmont’s here!!! (Jumps over the back off the couch and runs out into the street.)

content.description: Monica’s Restaurant’s kitchen, she’s cooking as a waitress sticks her head in.

content.speaker: Waitress
content.text: Hey Monica, there’s a customer who wants to complement the chef, should I let him in?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure, I love this part! (Starts to look busy.)

content.speaker: Waitress
content.text: Come on in.
(The customer turns out to be…)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Richard!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Actually, I’m not here to complement the chef.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh… Oh, that’s okay I hate when people come back to complement the chef. Like I have nothing better to do! So what’s up?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, it was great seeing you the other night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, good to see you too. Did you come down here to tell me that?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No! I came here to tell you something else. (Pause) I came here (Pause) to tell you I still love you.

content.description: Monica’s Restaurant, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What uh—What did you—What?!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I still love you. And I know I probably shouldn’t even be here telling you this, I mean you’re with Chandler a guy I really like, and if you say he’s straight I’ll believe you! After seeing ya the other night I knew if I didn’t tell ya I’d regret it for the rest of my life. Letting you go was the stupidest thing I ever did.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know you’re really not supposed to be back here!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well yeah, I’m sorry. I know this is the wrong time and the wrong place but I had to tell ya! I wanna spend my life with you. I wanna marry you. I wanna have kids with you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God… (Starts looking around.) Why don’t they put chairs back here?!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I know this is crazy but am I too late?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What the… Yes you’re too late! Where was all this three years ago?!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well I know I was an idiot! And I tried to forget you, I really did! Y’know after we had lunch last year I spent six months in Africa trying to get you out of my head!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What were you doing in Africa?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Working with blind kids.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhh! What are you doing to me?! Oh look, I-I… I’m sorry but umm, this-this-this-this is not going to happen.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay that’s fine, I’ll walk away. And I’ll never bother you again, but only if you tell me Chandler’s willing to give you everything I am.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well he is! Yeah, I mean marriage is all he talks about! My goodness, in fact, I’m the one that’s making him wait!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You are?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? Because of the government.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is bringing Phoebe some coffee.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Isn’t it incredible?! Monica and Chandler, gettin’ married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, they’re gonna be so happy together.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh… I mean two best friends falling in love, how often does that happen?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not that often!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! I’m so happy for them!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too! So happy for them!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m so happy and not at all jealous.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! No God, definitely not jealous!
(They both take a drink of coffee.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean I’m probably 98% happy, maybe 2% jealous. And I mean what’s 2%? That’s nothing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Totally. I’m like 90/10.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah me too.
(Joey enters looking like Captain Stubing from the Love Boat.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey uh, have you guys scene Chandler?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh—no, but y’know who did stop in here looking for ya, Tennille.

content.description: A Pizza Joint, Chandler and Monica are eating lunch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So that marriage stuff that you were saying yesterday, you don’t really believe that do you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure I do. In fact, I think the whole concept of marriage is unnatural. I mean look at pigs. Let’s take a second here and look at pigs. Okay pigs don’t mate for life. I mean a pig can have like a hundred sexual partners in a lifetime, and that’s just an ordinary pig not even a pig that’s good at sports!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but that’s pigs not people!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If marriage worked, I’d be all for it. But do you know what the divorce rate in this country is? 97%.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute. Are you honestly telling me that-that you may never want to get married?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, never say never but y’know probably uh yeah, never.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Then-then-then what are we even doing?! What is this?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What is all this pressure?! Is this some new kind of strategy? Why don’t you put down your copy of ‘The Rules’ huh mantrap?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what?! I gotta go! Ugh!
(She gets up and storms out. The people at the other tables are staring at Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s okay, I got a plan.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are still talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re gonna find love!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Definitely!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m pretty confident about that. That’s what makes it so easy for me to be 80% happy for Monica and Chandler! It would be nice to have a little guarantee though.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know, some people make deals with a friend, like if neither of them are married by the time they’re 40, they marry each other.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You mean a backup?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Exactly!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah I got that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hm-mmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you serious?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I locked him years ago!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh… So… If neither of you are married by the time you’re 40, you’re gonna marry Joey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep, we shook on it. Yeah but believe me that is not how he wanted to seal the deal.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, seriously?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, yeah. I think his exact words were… (She makes two clicking sounds with her tongue and purrs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Charming.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well hey, it’s just a backup.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey, still looking like Captain Stubing, is practicing his slipknots as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you seen Rachel? Or a mirror?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is for my boat, pretty cool huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, it’s great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa, what’s the matter?! Talk to the captain!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m just having one of those days where you realize you’re in a dead-end relationship!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler giving you a hard time huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not like I want to get married tomorrow! It’s just that I-I’d like to believe that I’m in a relationship that’s actually going somewhere, that I’m not just wasting my time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you know Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No I don’t know Chandler! Not anymore! It’s like it’s like something’s changed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe you changed?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I didn’t change!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe that’s the problem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler is a complex fellow, one who is unlikely to take a wife.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is that some kind of boat talk?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! (All excited) I haven’t totally decided how to talk on my boat yet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What does he think? Does he think I’m just gonna wait around for nothing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica face it, Chandler is against marriage. And-and always will be!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well there’s some people who do want to marry me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There are?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! Richard!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: R-R-Richard said he wants to marry you?! (Monica nods yes.) And-and Chandler’s tellin’ ya how much he hates marriage?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler loves marriage!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You just told me that he hates marriage! That-that he’s a-a complex fellow who’s unlikely to take a wife! That-that he’s against marriage and always will be!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got that from what I said?!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is watching a show about the extinction of the dinosaurs.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.text: When the Cretaceous period ended, the dinosaurs were gone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened you guys?
(There’s a knock on the door, he shuts the TV off, and answers it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, come on in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh thank you. Hey y’know, I’m so sorry to hear about you and Elizabeth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thanks. Yeah, I really thought we’d be able to make it work, but uh, I guess it just wasn’t meant to be.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, love. It’s a tricky business isn’t it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I guess so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what do you say we make a pact? If you and I are both single by the time we’re 40, we get married. I mean, we know each other, we like each other, and we’ve-we’ve already slept together so y’know there’ll be no surprises there! You know what I mean? No like, “What’s that?!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right. Ohh! You-you want me to be your backup.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Exactly.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, yeah I already have one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Who?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe?! Wait a—but-but she just, she said that Joey was her backup.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! I just had a conversation with her, and she said that she and Joey made a deal!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s impossible! I mean we have had a deal for years! We-we-we shook on it, although believe me she wanted to do a lot more than that.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler is entering to find Joey, still looking like Captain Stubing, on the phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where the hell have you been?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was making a coconut phone with the professor.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Richard told Monica he wants to marry her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah, I’ve been trying to find ya to tell to stop messing with her and maybe I would have if these (lifts a leg) damn boat shoes wouldn’t keep flying off!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My—Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! They suck!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s not supposed to ask my girlfriend to marry him! I’m supposed to do that!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well what… Y’know what I’m gonna do? I’m gonna go over there; I’m gonna kick his ass! (Pause) Will you help me?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Chandler I don’t think us getting our asses kicked is a solution. Okay? Just go and find Monica!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Starts running for the bedroom) I’m gonna get the ring! I’m gonna get the ring! (Does so) I’m gonna go find her and (starts running for the door) I’m just going to propose!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay great.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude-dude-dude!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let me know about that coconut phone, it might great for the boat.

content.description: Richard’s Apartment, he’s smoking a cigar and reading a book as there is a knock on the door. He gets up and opens the door to reveal…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know why I’m here.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I didn’t ask. You wanna come in?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, okay. Well, I’ll just leave the door open and go sit on the couch. (Does so.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler is such an idiot!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Drink?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I’ll have a scotch…

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: …on the rocks with a twist? I remember. (Goes to make her drink.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Still smoking cigars?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uh, no! No! That’s…art! If it bothers you I can put my art out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No that’s, that’s okay.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: So Monica let me ask you a question. Y’know, since we broke up do you ever, think about me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh yeah, I-I actually I thought about you a couple months ago.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah but it was because I-I had an eye exam and I don’t like my new eye doctor.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Edward Nevski?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah he’s no good. Do you ever (pause) think about me in a (pause) non-eye doctor way?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Ahh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But getting over was the hardest thing that I’ve ever had to do. And I never let myself think about you.
(Richard mouths, “Wow!”)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is reading as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe! You picked Joey and Ross?! You can not have two backups!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Of course I can! It’s just good sense to backup your backup! Look, I’ve already lost Chandler!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe! We’re both (points at Ross and himself) your backup?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, how could you do this to me?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t—Look I don’t know what you’re complaining about now? You were both aware of the situation!
(At the same time.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No we weren’t!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was not!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, this kind of back talk is not gonna fly when we’re married!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe you can’t have both of them! You have to pick one!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pick me!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Pick me! I don’t want to end up an old maid!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right well let’s see, Ross is a good father, but Joey has a boat—This is hard!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is crazy! Hey look, I wanna switch to Rachel!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ooh, I wanna switch to Rachel too!
(Rachel gets all happy.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No wait! Just—Okay—Just wait! You guys! Wait you guys! Don’t make any rash decisions, okay? Just remember my promise, when we get married, three times a week.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m talking about massages.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.
(She turns her head away and when she’s not looking, Phoebe shakes her head and mouths, “No, I’m not.” Both Joey and Ross smile, look at each other, and then stop smiling.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what?! I know-I know how to settle this! All right here, this is what we’re gonna do! I’m gonna write Joey on one napkin (does so) and I’m gonna right Ross on the other napkin (does so) and we are going to pick one! And that person is going to be our backup! Okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay that’s fair.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good!
(Rachel mixes them up in her hands, moves them all around, and puts her hands behind her back.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pick one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Left! (Rachel hands her the napkin in her left hand and they both unfold and read them.) Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! (Pause) We should just switch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah absolutely! (They both switch.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Richard’s Apartment, Monica is looking around and notices an African mask hanging on the wall.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I missed you-you ugly, flat faced old freak!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! (Laughs and points at the mask.) Him.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh. (Laughs.) Whew!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I missed this apartment! Now, this is a grown-up’s apartment! Y’know, I-I should be with a grown-up, do you know what I mean?!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah! You’re saying, you need to be with someone more mature. Maybe someone with, a license to practice medicine. Or a mustache.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, let’s face it, I’m not a kid anymore! I-I need to be with someone who-who wants the same things that I do! I mean coming to my place of work and telling me that you love me, I want that! Talking about pig sex over lunch, I don’t want that!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I think that’s fair.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fair? Please don’t even talk to me about fair! Fair would’ve been you wanting to marry me back then! Or fair would’ve been Chandler wanting to marry me now! Believe me, nothing about this is fair! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: It’s okay! Shh! Hey. Hey. (Hugs her) Shhhh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing. (She backs away a little bit but is still in his arms and looks up at his eyes.) I don’t kn—Umm. I don’t know. Umm…

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I know. (Backs away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I-I… I have to figure…some st—Y’know, some stuff before I can…

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah, I understand. Take as much time as you want. (Pause) Ten, even twenty minutes if you need it. I’ll be here. Not smoking. (Monica leaves.)

content.description: Richard’s Apartment, time lapse. Richard is smoking as he hears a knock on the door. He quickly puts out his cigar and opens the door.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where is she? I’m not scared of you! (Averts his eyes and walks in.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: She’s not here and please come in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Scotch on the rocks, with a twist, on a coaster? Ha-ha, Monica! Monica!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Okay, she was here, but she left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well where did she go?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well she said she had to think things over.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God, I can’t believe this! Y’know, I thought…I thought you were a good guy.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, hey look nothing happened.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nothing happened? Nothing? So you didn’t tell my girlfriend that you love her?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well all right, one thing happened?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? I can’t believe this! Do you know what you did? My girlfriend is out there thinking things over! You made my girlfriend think!!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And what does she have to think about? I love her!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well, apparently I’m willing to offer her things that you are not.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I am willing to offer her all those things. This was just a plan, y’know? A way to throw her off course so that when I offered her all these things, she’d be surprised!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well if it helps, it worked very well.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was working until you showed up, you big tree! I mean, this isn’t fair. You had your chance with her! You had your chance and you blew it! And this is my chance and I am not going to blow it because we are meant for each other! And this is all just been one stupid mistake! (Sits down heavily.) I was gonna propose tonight.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You were gonna propose? (Sits on the arm of the couch.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah I even (pause) got a ring. (Puts in on the center cushion.) Did you get a ring?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No I don’t have a ring! (Pause) You go get her Chandler. (Pause) And can I give you a piece of advice? If you do get her, don’t let her go. Trust me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know Richard…you are a good guy.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I know. (Pause) I hate that!
(Chandler gets up and runs out, but as soon as the door closes behind him he opens it, runs back in, picks up his ring Richard is holding up for him, and runs back out.)

content.description: The Hallway, Chandler is running up the stairs and towards his apartment, but Joey is taking out the garbage at the same time and stops him in the hall.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t talk to you now, I gotta find Monica!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s gone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s gone. She had a bag and she left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She was all crying. She-she said you guys want different things, and that and that she needed time to think.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well why didn’t you stop her?! Why didn’t you just tell her it was a plan?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I-I did! I told her everything, Chandler! But she wouldn’t believe me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well where… Where did she go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: To her parent’s I think and she said you shouldn’t call her. But if I were you I would.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe I ruined this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I am so sorry man.
(He walks dejectedly into his apartment to find it lit with about a thousand candles and Monica standing in the living room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You wanted it to be a surprise.
(He turns to look at Joey who smiles slyly and closes the door leaving them alone.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God.
(Monica gets down on one knee.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler… In all my life… I never thought I would be so lucky. (Starting to cry.) As to…fall in love with my best…my best… There’s a reason why girls don’t do this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (He joins her on one knee) Okay! Okay! Oh God, I thought… (Starting to cry, pauses) Wait a minute, I-I can do this. (Pause) I thought that it mattered what I said or where I said it. Then I realized the only thing that matters is that you, (Pause) you make me happier than I ever thought I could be. (Starting to cry again.) And if you’ll let me, I will spend the rest of my life trying to make you feel the same way. (Pause as he gets out the ring.) Monica, will you marry me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.
(The crowd goes wild as he puts the ring on her finger. They hug and kiss this time as an engaged couple.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I knew you were likely to take a wife!
(They hug again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can we come it yet?! We’re dying out here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come in! Come in! (Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe burst through the door.) We’re engaged!!!
(Everyone screams and has a group hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh, this is the least jealous I’ve ever been!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no wait no, this is wrong! Ross isn’t here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh hell, he’s done this three times! He knows what its about!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!
(They all hug again.)

content.description: [Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, it’s just Monica and Chandler dancing to Wonderful Tonight on the Slowhand album by Eric Clapton. And you can buy that album from the CFSI, just click on the CDNow link.]
